main event: A family observed four brilliant white lights moving over Lake Erie in Sagiwaw, Michigan on July 6, 1957.
interesting points: The lights were observed moving in a straight line and maintaining their relative positions to each other., They were about 200 feet above the ground and traveling at a very high rate of speed., The observation was made by three witnesses: a husband, their 24-year-old daughter, and another family member., An airplane was also spotted from Cleveland Hopkins Airport at the same time., The family initially thought the lights were stars before realizing they were moving.
sighted object: four brilliant white lights in the sky
witness description: a husband, their 24-year-old daughter, and another family member
